snippet: The United States Anti-Doping Agency’s report, which contended Lance Armstrong lied under oath, could revive attempts by an insurer to recoup a performance bonus.
abstract: New report by the United States Anti-Doping Agency could expose Lance Armstrong to new legal charges, including that of perjury, despite fact that federal prosecutors abandoned a criminal investigation against him earlier in the year; report amounts to a damning depiction of Armstrong as a main conspirator in a vast doping scheme.
lead_paragraph: The United States Anti-Doping Agency’s report, which contended Lance Armstrong lied under oath, could revive attempts by an insurer to recoup a performance bonus.

headline.seo: Usada’s Report Could Create New Legal Issues for Lance Armstrong
headline.main: Report Could Open Armstrong to Legal Issues
headline.print_headline: Report Could Open Armstrong to Legal Issues
